p: Carboxy methyl cellulase production was evaluated using the method by Zamani et al. [ 28]. The NA supplemented with 1% of carboxy methyl cellulose was inoculated with the isolates and incubated for 5 days at 28 °C. The negative control was Escherichia coli (ATCC 25922) while Cellulomonas humilata ATCC 2517 served as the positive control. The plates were then flooded with a solution of 0.5% Congo red. Isolates forming yellow coloured zones were considered positive for cellulase activity.
